meanings.definition: A large number or quantity of something
meanings.sent1: She had piles of books to read over the weekend.
meanings.sent2: The farmer had piles of hay in the barn.
meanings.sent3: The children made piles of sand at the beach to build a sandcastle.
meanings.sent4: The city had piles of garbage waiting to be collected.
meanings.sent5: The treasure hunter found piles of gold coins hidden in the cave.

meanings.definition: A heap or stack of objects
meanings.sent1: The construction workers created piles of bricks for the new building.
meanings.sent2: She organized her clothes into neat piles in the closet.
meanings.sent3: The chef prepared a delicious meal using piles of fresh vegetables.
meanings.sent4: The children built piles of blocks to create a tall tower.
meanings.sent5: The artist used piles of colorful paint tubes to create a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: A medical condition characterized by swollen and inflamed veins in the rectum and anus
meanings.sent1: He suffered from painful piles and had to seek medical treatment.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended a special cushion for relief from piles.
meanings.sent3: Despite the discomfort, he joked that his piles made sitting more interesting.
meanings.sent4: She compared the discomfort of piles to sitting on a bed of nails.
meanings.sent5: The advertisement promoted a cream to soothe the symptoms of piles.
